intro: Ulmus campestris f. vulgaris, commonly known as the field elm, is a variant of the European elm. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth margin and a dull green upper surface. It produces small, spherical fruits that are dispersed by wind. This variety is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in open woodland or along riverbanks.
